metadata.description: eXtensible Text Framework (XTF) is a highly-customizable, yet easy to deploy, open source platform for building digital repositories containing heterogeneous digital objects. It was developed by Martin Haye and Kirk Hastings at the California Digital Library (CDL). It is currently in use by a variety of institutions around the world and is the backbone for most of the CDLâ€™s digital collections. The software includes full Unicode support and operates on SunOS, Linux, and Windows operating systems. Its key features include customizable displays, advanced search functions, multilingual interface options, and the ability to handle large documents with ease.
